properties.areaDesc: Lake Superior from Saxon Harbor WI to Upper Entrance to Portage Canal MI 5NM off shore to the US/Canadian border including Isle Royal National Park; Ontonagon to Upper Entrance of Portage Canal MI; Point Isabelle to Lower Entrance of Portage Canal MI; Huron Islands to Marquette MI; Lake Superior West of Line from Manitou Island to Marquette MI Beyond 5NM from shore; Lake Superior west of a line from Saxon Harbor WI to Grand Portage MN beyond 5NM; Black River To Ontonagon MI; Lake Superior from Upper Entrance to Portage Canal to Manitou Island MI 5NM off shore to the US/Canadian Border; Manitou Island to Point Isabelle MI; Saxon Harbor WI to Black River MI; Portage Lake to Huron Island MI to Lower Entrance of Portage Canal To Huron Islands MI Including Keweenaw and Huron Bays; Upper Entrance of Portage Canal to Eagle River MI; Eagle River to Manitou Island MI
properties.headline: Heavy Freezing Spray Warning issued February 18 at 4:22AM EST until February 19 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Marquette MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy freezing spray at a rate of 2 cm per hour or
greater expected, and may rapidly accumulate on vessels.

* WHERE...Portions of Central and Western Lake Superior.

* WHEN...From 4 PM EST /3 PM CST/ this afternoon to 10 PM EST /9
PM CST/ Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Operating a vessel in heavy freezing spray is
hazardous. Freezing spray may render mechanical and electronic
components inoperative. Rapid ice accretion on decks and
superstructures may result in a catastrophic loss of stability.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should prepare for dangerous accumulation of ice on
their vessel. If possible, remain in port, avoid the warning area
or conduct mitigation.

NWSheadline: HEAVY FREEZING SPRAY WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM EST /3 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 PM EST /9 PM CST/ WEDNESDAY
